thread.title: Blast, fire hit Army’s Camp Aquino in Tarlac
thread.title_full: Blast, fire hit Army’s Camp Aquino in Tarlac

author: cbibe
title: Blast, fire hit Army’s Camp Aquino in Tarlac
text:
By: Frances Mangosing - Reporter / @FMangosingINQ INQUIRER.net / 08:27   Fire consumes whatever is left of the Army Support Command’s Armaments Battalion inside Camp Servillano Aquino in Tarlac City, Tarlac. The fire Tuesday night, Feb. 7, 2017, was reportedly preceded by an explosion that apparently blew off the roof of the building. PHOTO FROM THE TARLAC INFORMATION OFFICE FACEBOOK PAGE 
A powerful explosion and a fire hit the Army Support Command’s Armaments Battalion inside Camp Aquino in San Miguel, Tarlac, on Tuesday evening. 
Armed Forces public affairs office chief Col. Edgard Arevalo said the blast occured at about 10:30 p.m. and was followed by fire. Firefighters put out the blaze about an hour later. 
The cause of the fire has not been determined. ADVERTISEMENT 
Arevalo could not immediately say if there were casualties from the incident. 
He dismissed social media reports, especially on Facebook, that terrorists were behind the explosion. Empty wooden crates are stacked outside the Army Support Command’s Armaments Battalion building inside Camp Aquino, which was hit by a blast and a fire Tuesday night, Feb. 7, 2017. PHOTO FROM TARLAC INFORMATION OFFICE FACEBOOK PAGE 
“Walang nangyaring sabotahe o pag atake ng kalaban. More on safety issue ito,” he said. (There’s no sabotage or enemy attack.) 
The headquarters of the Northern Luzon Command of the AFP is located at Camp Aquino. CBB
